ch.nolix.common.util

Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.common.util.Time

  • public final class Time
extends java.lang.Object
    A time stores a point in time with a precision of 1 millisecond. A time stores a point in time according to the Gregorian calendar. Since the Gregorian calendar is not proleptic (does officialy not allow calculations backwards from the point of its release, that was in 1582) a time can only store a point in time after 1600-01-01 00:00:000. A time can be freezed so that it cannot be changed anymore.
